activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12039
activity.text:
I have resolved This changes what i did added min-w and w-full for valid form which were missing 
code snippet 
          <div className="grid md:grid-cols-2 gap-4 w-full ">
            <FormField
              control={form.control}
              name="valid_from"
              render={({ field }) => (
                <FormItem className="flex flex-col w-full min-w-[210px]">
                  <FormLabel aria-required>{t("valid_from")}</FormLabel>
                  <DatePicker
                    date={field.value}
                    onChange={(date) => field.onChange(date)}
                  />
                  <FormMessage />
                </FormItem>
              )}
            />

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11930
activity.text:
The issue with the bottom part of the <EncounterInfoCard /> content getting hidden behind the fixed message input bar on mobile devices has been resolved.

I verified the layout locally and confirmed that adding bottom padding

) inside <CardContent> ensures the content is fully visible and scrollable without being obstructed.

Everything is working as expected now. Ready for review

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11718
activity.text:
Describe your solution clearly:
I will add a table skeleton loader using the existing UI components (e.g., Material UI, Tailwind, or custom styling) to show while the Appointments List is loading. This loader will maintain layout consistency and improve user experience. Additionally, I‚Äôll replace the current static empty state with a more informative and user-friendly empty state ‚Äî including an icon, message, and optional CTA (e.g., "Book your first appointment").

Expected Timeline:
End date: April 7, 2025

Additional Context:
No new dependencies are needed. This enhancement is focused on improving the UI/UX and can be implemented using the current component structure. Will ensure it's mobile-responsive and accessible.
please assign me this work

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11702
activity.text:
Hi ashwinpraveengo, would like to work on this issue.

Proposed Solution:
Responsive Design Fixes

Ensure the PDF viewer container uses flexbox or grid for proper scaling on mobile screens.

Use CSS media queries to adjust width, height, and positioning of zoom controls and navigation buttons for smaller screens.

Error Handling Improvement

Debug why the "Failed to load PDF file" error occurs on mobile.

Ensure the PDF.js library (or any viewer being used) properly loads files on mobile.

Test different rendering methods like object/embed/iframe to check for compatibility issues.

Touch-Friendly Controls

Increase button size for zoom and navigation controls for better mobile usability.

Add swipe gestures for navigation between pages if applicable.

Expected Timeline:
End date: April 5, 2025

Additional Context:
I will test the fixes on multiple mobile devices, including Samsung Galaxy M34 (Android) and other screen sizes.

If needed, I will integrate a mobile-responsive PDF viewer library for better adaptability.

Please assign me this issue, and I will provide updates as I make progress.

Thanks!
